unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – Manufacturing firms across India are ramping up vendor audits in anticipation of increased demand during the Diwali and pre-Onam season. Concerns surrounding raw material quality and ethical sourcing practices have driven a surge in rigorous supplier evaluations.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – Manufacturing firms across India are ramping up vendor audits in anticipation of increased demand during the Diwali and pre-Onam season. Concerns surrounding raw material quality and ethical sourcing practices have driven a surge in rigorous supplier evaluations.

unnormalised: Leading engineering conglomerate, Larsen & Toubro (L&T), recently concluded a series of audits focusing on their steel suppliers in Chattisgarh. These audits targeted compliance with BIS standards and labor regulations.
normalised: Leading engineering conglomerate, L and T, recently concluded a series of audits focusing on their steel suppliers in Chattisgarh. These audits targeted compliance with B I S standards and labor regulations.

unnormalised: Similarly, textile manufacturers in Tirupur are facing pressure to improve transparency in their cotton sourcing. Audit findings revealed discrepancies in some supply chains, highlighting the need for better traceability.

unnormalised: "Ensuring consistent quality is paramount, especially when demand for products like readymade garments and packaged biryani soars during the festive season," stated Mr. Sharma, a senior consultant at KPMG India. "Our audits uncover potential risks and help clients maintain their brand reputation."
